pros: Some of the people are really lovely to work with.
cons:
The management and lots of staff make it hard to work there, very much a culture of bullying, this results in a fairly high turnover of staff.
Management are not understanding of workers with families (i.e small children), and will berate you for not being able to make training days or other activities (outside of your contracted work hours) even if they give you less than 24 hours notice.
Also, good luck if you take a weekend job, communication is non-existent, and yet you get the blame if you do not know the information you're supposed to, also simple things like booking holiday become troublesome because you often get overlooked due never being in the building at the same time as your manager.
Also if you expect to have access to all of the kit you require for your job that your weekday colleagues have access to, guess again! They appear to like to lock things away where you're unable to access them, then when you're unable to do your job, you get blamed by management.
